snippet: For many Mormon college students, there’s a different rite of passage: spreading the word, cut off from home and virtually all earthly pleasures.
abstract: Many young Mormons put their studies on hold to become missionaries for two years in far-flung countries, often in Africa; all but cut-off from home, they must adapt to unfamiliar cultures and stricter church rules; most resume their studies upon returning home.
lead_paragraph: For many Mormon college students, there’s a different rite of passage: spreading the word, cut off from home and virtually all earthly pleasures.
